intro: Rhododendron subenerve, commonly known as the narrow-veined rhododendron, is a species native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with elliptical leaves that have prominent, narrow veins. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to red, often blooming in late spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and used in horticultural landscapes.
